column1:
Home | Information | Book Now | Get Directions | Contact Us

OceanView B&B

Gallery

About Us

Located on the north coast of Kerry, OceanView B&B is a family owned and run, bed and breakfast accomodation house. We cater to families of all ages and sizes, tourist groups and students alike. We are a just a short walk from Banna Beach, and only 10 minutes away from Kerry's largest town, Tralee. For directions please click here.

Our rooms availabe include, twin rooms, single rooms, double rooms and family rooms. For more details see our information page, where you will also find our room rates.

Some facilities and services we offer are laundry facilities, kitchen, dining room, games room, wifi service and television room. A sports ground and playground are also available across the road from our establishment. To see more click here.

Local attractions include the glorious banna beach, Ardfert cathedral, the beautiful seaside town of Ballyheigue and many more. You can view a complete and more detailed list, also on our information page.

Check in times are between 1pm and 3pm. Check out time is 12pm. We are checked by B&B Ireland and accept credit and debit cards as forms of payment, along with cash and cheques.

We operate in euro, as that is the official currency in Ireland. Our local weather is usually relativly pleasant but do expect rain if you come to our part of the world. We would advise checking the local weather forecast when planning your trip as the weather can sometimes be unpredicatble.

Unfortunately we do not accomodate for pets in our bed and breakfast. If a guest has a visual impairment and requires a guide dog, we would be more than willing to accomodate them, in any way we can, once notice is given, when booking a room. We also have a no smoking policy in our rooms but we do provide smoking facilities outdoors.

Back to top

Copyright © 2016 OceanView B&B. All rights reserved. | Place of Registration: Ireland

column1:
UNESCO UniversAbility Audit

The audit below will help you to get a sense of your organisation's representativeness of the community in which it is located. Ideally any organisation would reflect the demographics of its setting e.g. gender, age and ethnicity. In this instance we are interested in the relevance of your organisation to people with disabilities.

Please consider the following questions and identify your level of agreement with the statement

  1. Strongly Disagree
  2. Disagree
  3. Nuetral/ Don't know
  4. Agree
  5. Strongly agree
Section 1: Verification
1 2 3 4 5
I and/or my colleagues know where to get information to help us analyse the business case for consciously attracting people with disabilities as members
I/my colleagues have researched the scope for increasing the participation of the broader community, in particular people with disabilites
I know of disability service providers that I could link with in the local community
My colleagues and I make our services inclusive to provide for people with disabilities

Section 2: Value Proposition
1 2 3 4 5
My colleagues and I have a significant contribution to make to the quality of life of people in our community, including people with disabilities
My colleagues and I have the scope to improve opportunities for participation in fitness activities for people living in. or visiting our community, including people with disabilities
The benefits of increasing our UniversAbility to increase participation are clear
My colleagues and I play a major role in providing health services to the entire community, including people with disabilities
The UniversAbility of our fitness services increases the job satisfaction and turnover of my staff

Section 3: Vision
1 2 3 4 5
My colleagues and I envision ourselves as leaders of cultural change

Which of the following statements best describes your situation within your organisation (Please select one)

I and/or my colleagues have identified set targets for increasing the UniversAbility of our services and are putting strategies in place to achieve these goals
I and/or my colleagues have identified scope for increasing the UniversAbility of our services
I think there may be scope for making our services more inclusive but am not sure
I have never considered making our services more inclusive until now
I don't think making our services more inclusive, in particular for people with disabilities, is really an option for us but won't rule it out completely until it has been fully explored

Section 4: Philosophy

1. Does your organisation have stated ideals in your strategic plan or other management documents which relate to the UniversAbility of your services?

Yes No

2. Do you think an inclusive philosophy is a lived experience by:

a) Management?
b) Staff?
c) Customers?

Section 5: Policy

1. Does your charging policy account for the varied needs of your customers? (e.g. No charge for personal assistants

Yes No

2. Do you track and monitor the proportion of your club members who experience disabilities?

Yes No

3. Have you a budget allocated to:

a) Increasing the UniversAbility of your services? (e.g. Facilities, Equipment and Staff Training)

Yes No
Not needed because equipment is already fully accessible

b) Increasing the UniversAbility of your policies?

Yes No

4. Are you familiar with the national legislation that relates to disability service provision?

Yes No

Section 6: Processes

1. Do you engage with disability groups in your local community?

Yes No

2. Have you forged any alliance/partnership with any disability organisation?

Yes No

3. Have you or your staff embraced any assistive tehnologies (e.g. Assist-Mi App)?

Yes No

4. Have you or your colleagues undertaken any research on making your service more inclusive?

Yes No

5. Do you encourage your staff to engage in customer satisfaction conversations with different user groups?

Yes No

Section 7: Perception

1. Do you gather information from your users on their beliefs about fitness being a fundamental right for all?

Yes No

2. Do you gather information from people who do not use your facility on fitness being a fundamental right for all?

Yes No

Section 8: Programmes

This section refers to programmes that you deliver, or support delivery of to conciously inclusivise your services

1. Do you and your staff provide programmes specifically for people with disabilities?

Yes No

If Yes please complete the table below

Disability Category YES
Type (Segregated or Integrated)
Physical Disabilities
Intellectual Disabilities
Sensory Disabilities
Mental Health Difficulties

2. Do people with disabilities use the gym, pool, or participate in group activites etc. alongside other members?

Yes No

If Yes please complete the table below

Disability Category YES
Type (Segregated or Integrated)
Physical Disabilities
Intellectual Disabilities
Sensory Disabilities
Mental Health Difficulties

Section 9: People

1. Have you or sny of your staff/volunteers had training that facilitates the inclusion of people with disabilities?

a) Operational (teaching/instructional staff)
Yes No

b) Management
Yes No

c) Front of house
Yes No

d) Stakeholders/ Contacted staff
Yes No

2. Are people with disabilities employed by you organisation and/or represented on your steering committee/ management committee/ board of management etc.?

Yes No

3. Is there a member of staff allocated as a liason/point person for customers with disabilities?

Yes No

Section 10: Physical Access/Place

1. Have you or your colleagues carried out an audit to evaluate the UniversAbility of your facility?

Yes No

2. Does your facility (or the facility you use) consider the following disabilites when evaluating UniversAbility?

Disability Category YES
Physical Disabilities
Intellectual Disabilities
Sensory Disabilities
Mental Health Difficulties

Section 11: Promotion

1. Is your promotional material inclusive of people with disabilities?

Yes No

2. Have you or your colleagues/staff developed any promotional materials with the aim of attracting people with disabilities?

Yes No

Overall Comment on your organisation:

UNESCO UniversAbility Audit

The audit below will help you to get a sense of your organisation's representativeness of the community in which it is located. Ideally any organisation would reflect the demographics of its setting e.g. gender, age and ethnicity. In this instance we are interested in the relevance of your organisation to people with disabilities.

Please consider the following questions and identify your level of agreement with the statement

  1. Strongly Disagree
  2. Disagree
  3. Nuetral/ Don't know
  4. Agree
  5. Strongly agree
Section 1: Verification
1 2 3 4 5
I and/or my colleagues know where to get information to help us analyse the business case for consciously attracting people with disabilities as members
I/my colleagues have researched the scope for increasing the participation of the broader community, in particular people with disabilites
I know of disability service providers that I could link with in the local community
My colleagues and I make our services inclusive to provide for people with disabilities

Section 2: Value Proposition
1 2 3 4 5
My colleagues and I have a significant contribution to make to the quality of life of people in our community, including people with disabilities
My colleagues and I have the scope to improve opportunities for participation in fitness activities for people living in. or visiting our community, including people with disabilities
The benefits of increasing our UniversAbility to increase participation are clear
My colleagues and I play a major role in providing health services to the entire community, including people with disabilities
The UniversAbility of our fitness services increases the job satisfaction and turnover of my staff

Section 3: Vision
1 2 3 4 5
My colleagues and I envision ourselves as leaders of cultural change

Which of the following statements best describes your situation within your organisation (Please select one)

I and/or my colleagues have identified set targets for increasing the UniversAbility of our services and are putting strategies in place to achieve these goals
I and/or my colleagues have identified scope for increasing the UniversAbility of our services
I think there may be scope for making our services more inclusive but am not sure
I have never considered making our services more inclusive until now
I don't think making our services more inclusive, in particular for people with disabilities, is really an option for us but won't rule it out completely until it has been fully explored

Section 4: Philosophy

1. Does your organisation have stated ideals in your strategic plan or other management documents which relate to the UniversAbility of your services?

Yes No

2. Do you think an inclusive philosophy is a lived experience by:

a) Management?
b) Staff?
c) Customers?

Section 5: Policy

1. Does your charging policy account for the varied needs of your customers? (e.g. No charge for personal assistants

Yes No

2. Do you track and monitor the proportion of your club members who experience disabilities?

Yes No

3. Have you a budget allocated to:

a) Increasing the UniversAbility of your services? (e.g. Facilities, Equipment and Staff Training)

Yes No
Not needed because equipment is already fully accessible

b) Increasing the UniversAbility of your policies?

Yes No

4. Are you familiar with the national legislation that relates to disability service provision?

Yes No

Section 6: Processes

1. Do you engage with disability groups in your local community?

Yes No

2. Have you forged any alliance/partnership with any disability organisation?

Yes No

3. Have you or your staff embraced any assistive tehnologies (e.g. Assist-Mi App)?

Yes No

4. Have you or your colleagues undertaken any research on making your service more inclusive?

Yes No

5. Do you encourage your staff to engage in customer satisfaction conversations with different user groups?

Yes No

Section 7: Perception

1. Do you gather information from your users on their beliefs about fitness being a fundamental right for all?

Yes No

2. Do you gather information from people who do not use your facility on fitness being a fundamental right for all?

Yes No

Section 8: Programmes

This section refers to programmes that you deliver, or support delivery of to conciously inclusivise your services

1. Do you and your staff provide programmes specifically for people with disabilities?

Yes No

If Yes please complete the table below

Disability Category YES
Type (Segregated or Integrated)
Physical Disabilities
Intellectual Disabilities
Sensory Disabilities
Mental Health Difficulties

2. Do people with disabilities use the gym, pool, or participate in group activites etc. alongside other members?

Yes No

If Yes please complete the table below

Disability Category YES
Type (Segregated or Integrated)
Physical Disabilities
Intellectual Disabilities
Sensory Disabilities
Mental Health Difficulties

Section 9: People

1. Have you or sny of your staff/volunteers had training that facilitates the inclusion of people with disabilities?

a) Operational (teaching/instructional staff)
Yes No

b) Management
Yes No

c) Front of house
Yes No

d) Stakeholders/ Contacted staff
Yes No

2. Are people with disabilities employed by you organisation and/or represented on your steering committee/ management committee/ board of management etc.?

Yes No

3. Is there a member of staff allocated as a liason/point person for customers with disabilities?

Yes No

Section 10: Physical Access/Place

1. Have you or your colleagues carried out an audit to evaluate the UniversAbility of your facility?

Yes No

2. Does your facility (or the facility you use) consider the following disabilites when evaluating UniversAbility?

Disability Category YES
Physical Disabilities
Intellectual Disabilities
Sensory Disabilities
Mental Health Difficulties

Section 11: Promotion

1. Is your promotional material inclusive of people with disabilities?

Yes No

2. Have you or your colleagues/staff developed any promotional materials with the aim of attracting people with disabilities?

Yes No

Overall Comment on your organisation:
